Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not smoke free. They do not enforce. Very load music from terrace and no consideration to the cudtomer”
Reviews.Author: Mentesh
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at this hotel. Very load music and the rooms are not smoke free as they claim

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: dodyna11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for 4 nights in Troya during April 2012. Room size is acceptable, new furnished and clean. The hotel is very close to the Istiklal Street. We have an early check in and we asked to replace the check out day breakfast with the check in date and they confirmed with pleasure. Also hotel arranged both transfers (arrival and departure) with reasonable price 25 EUR per way for 4 persons and 35 EUR for 6 persons. Internet was wireless and free. The stuff was very helpful and always smiling they can speak English and Arabic. Breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in Beyoglu”
Reviews.Author: CERS
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel in the Centre of Beyoglu Quarter. Fifteen minutes by walk to Galata Tower, or Taksim Square. A the top of the Hotel (8th floor) there is the restaurant and breakfast hall....really wonderful to have your breakfast looking for the city landscape with the different golden top of the Mosques under the sun. Friendly service. Clean rooms. The restaurant is also good, and during the week end offers musical turkish or mediterranean musical shows....a little bit too loud...The breakfast, in continental style, is very good. At the ground floor there is a nice bar. Out of the Hotel, on the right side, there is a nice Thai restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Michababyj
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really great, very close to the istiklal street where all the shops and the restaurants are. The only draw back is that the rooms are small so if u can afford it upgrade to a suite which is relatively cheaper than in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 5n on an internet offer which got me a small room with a window only into the hole in the middle of the building as mentioned in previous reviews. despite being small the room was nice, with a minibar and a clean bathroom. there was noise from the corridor at night, waking me up sometimes. breakfast on the roof terrace was very good with nice views. even though there was a table on which to lay a laptop, there was no proper chair at all. this was slightly annoying. gym and pool(??) were under renovation, hardly surprising for the price. internet was wireless and free, but went through a very annoying gateway which required keeping the login tab open all the time, otherwise the connection was dropped. there was already a password for the wifi connection, is it really necessary to have the guests login via the gateway? or is it for some religious police supervision? re: location, one block off istiklal the crowded pedestrian street. coming back from metro station in the afternoon and evening took almost 30min due to having to plough trough the mass of humans. but for attractions of beyoglu it was very convenient. nothing really to say about the staff - they were not rude but not nice (e.g. smiles, hellos) either, english was sub-par. but i found it good value for money anyway, having booked it on the last possible minute.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: damoose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple of friends in May, 2011. We booked this hotel because we wanted to be close to beyoglu/taksim and this was the cheapest option I could find ($145/night for a triple room). I didn't expect much given the price, but boy were we surprised! The hotel is off a small side street from Istikal street which was perfect for us. Istikal street and all the action is within a short 2 min walk from the hotel but being in a side street helped keep the noise away at night. The room we stayed in appeared recently refurbished. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels (as a tourist and business traveller), but never seen anything nearly as modern as the Troya room. Everything was touch screen (switches, a/c control, etc) including the elevator buttons. TV was LCD. Bathroom was fabulous - very clean and modern and with running hot and cold water. Shower had 2 shower heads - one was a pull out/hand held shower and another was an overhead rain shower. Service was excellent. I don't remember the names of the gentlemen at the reception but there were two - one in the day shift and another in the evening shift. The day shift guy was especially helpful and both speak excellent English. General guidelines - 1. My buddies arrived before me and took a cab from the airport to the hotel. It cost them 45 lira. I took Havas bus from the airport to the Taksim square (10 lira) and then a cab from Taksim to the hotel (told the cabbie Tepebashi as he didn't know Troya). The cab cost an additional 10 lira (I think more like 5 but the guy asked for 10). 2. To go to Sultanahmet, you have 3 options - - walk - takes about 30 mins and not really recommended. - take a train to Taksim square and catch another train to Sultanahmet - not recommended but this was the initial option that the reception gave us. - walk to Tophane station (10 min) and then catch a train from there (1.5 lira). We did this and it was the best option in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: khuang82
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small, and there was no view from the window. When we checked in there was an angry, spoiled, diva of a Greek woman throwing a tantrum about the lack of natural light in her room. Our room faced a bare wall in some kind of shaft in the middle of the building; it didn't let in very much natural light. I can see what she was complaining about, but this didn't bother me at all. Who wants to stay in the bustling Taksim/Beyoglu area to hang out in the hotel room all day? Step outside and choose from a huge array of restaurants and cafes. The room was clean, comfortable and modern. It was clearly a smoking room, and the refrigerator in the room barely worked. Our room was two floors from the top, where there is a terrace. There was a lot of noise coming from the terrace each night, including loud bumping music, even though we were two floors below. The doors are a little on the thin side, so they let in some noise from the hallways. But I was able to sleep perfectly fine. The bathroom was clean and nice. The back-street Troya is on doesn't have much going on. It's a good 10-15 minute walk from Taksim Square, but and a very short walk from Istikal Caddesi. which is extremely popular with the young Turkish crowd. Istikal and its many side streets are filled with bars, clubs, restaurants, cafes, shops, etc, and there is a ton to do. There's a tremendous buzz about this neighborhood, and I loved it. Nightlife here is much better than in Sultanahmet. If you're looking for a quiet, relaxed atmosphere, this isn't the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Small Rooms, Turkish Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lazaroz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect place near the Pera and Taxim square. The rooms were very small without a window. The breakfash was Turkish. The people of the hotel was very helpfull to everything. Average hotel and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Troya is close to Istiklal Caddesi with good food.”
Reviews.Author: SaintPaulTraveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the staff were kind and helpful. They provided a receipt for me upon my request after making payment for 10 nights in cash. They put us in a room which was not very nice, the bed was old, and the street was very noisy, but which had a great view over the building across Mesrutiyet Caddesi to the city. After a few noisy nights from the traffic on Mesrutiyet, I asked for a quiet room which they gladly gave to us. Our room looked over a quiet alley, the room was smaller, but the accomodations were nicer. The food was excellent at breakfast with a wide selection of fruits, beverages, and cheeses, and breads and all was nicely presented. The front desk staff was helpful and made good suggestions to me as a first time traveler to Istanbul. I asked for advice regarding where to eat and what to see as well as using my guide book. I appreciated being on the north side of the Golden Horn near the newer side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves”
Reviews.Author: chicha6660763
Reviews.Content: Ridiculously small rooms. No apologies given for construction on upper floors going on all afternoon. Charged us $70 for 3lbs of laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Airconditioned . . . sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict0077
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with several friends as part of a trip to Istanbul for the wedding of friends. The location is great -- a quick, safe walk to Istiklal Caddesi, and an easy cab ride to the Grand Bazaar and other locations. The rooms are worn, but perfectly serviceable and roomy by European standards, and the breakfast is plentiful and good. I appreciated the free internet access on two computers just off the lobby -- almost always at least one was available. The staff was outstanding during my visit, and very accommodating when we needed to change from a triple to a double at the last minute because of an unexpected cancellation of one member of our group. They were also great about storing our excess bags when we left for a couple of days to go to Southern Turkey before returning to Istanbul for our last nights. My only word of caution concerns the air conditioning -- when we went, the hotel advertised air conditioning on the website. However, when we arrived, we discovered that the air conditioning was not turned on yet in the rooms (it was on in the lobby) because May was not considered "air conditioning season." It's my understanding that they won't turn the air on until June, no matter how hot it is. Before you reserve, you might want to find out if they plan to have the air conditioning turned on in the rooms during your stay; otherwise, don't expect to sleep too much past sunrise in warm weather, when it starts to get noisy (especially with open windows) and hot. I think this is a common practice in Istanbul, as some friends of ours at other hotels had the same experience, so ask ahead wherever you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: ErieOn-the-road
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a very convenient location and is cheap related to other nearby hotels. What you get is a clean room and staff willing to help you. However the standard room is small and in May that we visited the room was very hot, but the air conditioning was not functioning in all the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ath_sun21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Troya hotel for 4nights. Our room was located on the 2nd floor (non smoking floor). Room was very clean and we had clean towels everyday. Breakfast was really good and had a nice variety (Combines both Turkish and Interantional foods) Hotel is located 2minutes away from Istiklal cad., 10 min. from Taxim square and Galata Tower (2 different directions). Location is very good and safe. Staff is friendly and they are always available to give you any information/guideline about timetables, tours, city highlights etc Hotel has an internet corner with 2 computers free of charge for all clients Good value for money. Highly recommended as a clean, safe, budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: shahrokhg
Reviews.Content: an inexpensive hotel located in the center of Istanbul, very close to the exotic Beyoglu street and the Golden Horn just at your feet. the lobby is nice and modern, the staff specially those at the reservation, cool helpful and friendly. the size of the rooms is good comparing to what you find in Europe. the rooms are definitely in need of restoration but tolerable at the moment. bath suffers the same problem. however the rooms are clean and odorless i shall state. the breakfast is lovely and quite diverse for the price you pay and you can serve yourself with the Boreks. i saw families with the kids at the breakfast and made me decide to bring the family next time. i have been to Hilton and Marmara and some 4 stars in Istanbul but this one definitely worth the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, good location, safe environment”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLINGALONE068
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Troya for a week (attending a conference) and found it a really easy place to be. I'm female, getting on, not necessarily keen on walking around some places on my own. But the location was good, not at all threatening, and close to Istiklal Cad, Taksim with all its buses, within walking distance of the Galata Bridge, lots of ATMs, loads of fantastic restaurants etc. The Hotel staff were helpful and friendly, and the breakfast excellent. My room was ordinary, but it was also cheap and I could open the window for fresh air if I wanted to. The Troya was very good value and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Brightrob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during my trip to Istanbul. This place was recommended by a friend of mine and I must say that I was very happy with it. It was located in the centre of Istanbul, very close to shops and restaurants. OK, so the room was very average, but this is a budget hotel, so if you expect luxury, you should stay at 5 star hotel, where you will pay 5 times the price. I found staff helpful and polite. There are two computers in the reception area that can be used for free. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice of food, including fresh food. I would cestainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel .. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wesam316
Reviews.Content: Its all about the location people .. and add to that a very friendly hotel members each one of them was really helpful, and they even allowed us to check in earlier than the time we suppose to .. there is a special trasport that u can choose to pick u and drop u from and to the airport .. everything is near you Isteklal road .. and Taqseem square is just walking distance .. i would surely go back there again .. the breakfast was okay nothing fancy but u can always go back the ally and find your self a lovely turkish food .. everything was good about me going to istanbul and i had alot of un ..

Reviews.Title: “Good but with drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Bostontea
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in this hotel. First impressions were good as the Reception area looked very clean and modern. Elsewhere the hotel was 'tired' and in need of redecoration. My room was very small and the decor left a lot to be desired. The most serious problems were in the bathroom. Badly broken and chiped shower which rarely worked. Also, I wasn't terribly sure if the bed clothes were clean and opted to sleep on top of the bed - thankfully it was warm enought to do that.

Reviews.Title: “a good staying”
Reviews.Author: le_xaGreece
Reviews.Content: the hotel worthed its money, it was exactly what we wanted as far as the location is concerned, and pretty good for our budget. the proximity to istiklal cad., where a good sample of the night life was taking place, and generally to trasportation (near a bus station and the taksim metro station), was remarkable. our room was clean enough, small though and not with plenty of air (but there are rooms looking to the street, so ask for one!), but with new toilet facilities (a big plus!). The breakfast was rich, and served until 10 (i think..), which was good news! finally, the stuff was pleasant, and we had free trasfer from the airport to the hotel (but not the other way round).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, perfect breakfast, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: goodaid
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good location - not far from the airport, close to Taxim and Istiklal Cad, but at the same time, very quiet and safe. Breakfast was excellent - fresh orange juice, lots of food - not only chees, eggs and bread. It was clean, but our room was not big and we had horrible view - 3metres away windows of other room! But you couldnt expect for 70 $ (we paid for two people) much more. The Internet connection is very very very bad, which was good for me - otherwise I would spend most of the time at the hotel checking something. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Inexpensive Hotel Close to the Action (But not too close)”
Reviews.Author: kate0614
Reviews.Content: I picked the Troya Hotel because it was cheap and close to Istiklal Cd., but I ended up being pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. Don't get me wrong, it's not the Ritz, but it seemed like a way nicer hotel overall than would be indicated by the price. The room was huge (especially as compared to the hotel we stayed at in Sultanahmet) and actually pretty decently furnished, if you can get past the bed covers and drapes, which are a hideous rust-orange color. Luckily you could flip the bed covers over to their inoffensive black lining. As for the rest, the beds were nice and comfortable, there was a little sitting area with sofa, coffee table, and TV, and the bathroom was clean. Water pressure in the shower was terrible, but I guess you can't have everything. The staff is very nice. The clincher on this hotel, though, is the location. It's a short block from the shopping, restaurants, and bars of Istiklal Cd., an easy walk north to Taksim Square or south to Tunel, and yet -- this is key -- just far enough away to be QUIET. One night when we were out bar hopping we passed another hotel where we had considered staying, and I thanked my lucky stars we hadn't ended up there -- it was directly on top of one of the liveliest, loudest rows of bars and clubs in Istanbul. When you are planning your trip, this sort of thing is impossible to discern from looking at a map -- some of the side streets off Istiklal Cd. are quiet, and some are lined with bars and raucous crowds that go all night. The great thing about the Troya is that you can walk out your door and be in the heart of the action in two minutes, but when you're ready to come home and sleep, you can do so in peace. The only thing I can really complain about is the wireless internet. It sucked. Slow as molasses when it was working, and frequently down. Oh well. And I can't comment on the breakfast, because we never woke up in time to eat it (it is served 7:30-10:00 AM).

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Troya”
Reviews.Author: kathydillion
Reviews.Content: Before going on my trip to Istanbul I read a review of the hotel where I was staying, The Troya. Someone wrote that the breakfasts were under par, but I want to update that information. The hotel management told me that they changed the way they present breakfast now and I was very impressed. There was a long buffet that included eggs, museli, yogurt, salad, halawa, rolls, toast, cucumbers, fruit and a host of drinks including sahleb, coffee, juice, assorted teas, and milk. The breakfast, included in the price, was one of the highlights of my stay. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but.....”
Reviews.Author: KaGu
Reviews.Content: The "Troya" hotel is tucked away on a small street, southwest of the Taksim square. It will take you five minutes of walking to reach the Istical Cad., with its tram, all of its shops and restaurants; and another fifteen to walk to the Taksim Square itself. Upon arrival, I was given a single room which provided an OK standard - with a pleasant enough bathroom. The windows faced an inward shaft, with windows from the opposite side very close. The only solution was to close the curtains, and in such a small room you then soon start to feel pretty cramped. The air-condition, although in working order, never managed to lower the temperature below about 23 Celsius; which was way to hot for me. I asked for a better situated and larger room - ufortunately, one was not available until the next day. This upgrade added about USD 35 pr night to my prepaid bill. The new room was much larger, and had street facing windows, which came as a relief (although the street noise was considerable). Like in so many Southern European and Middle East countries, The Turks honk their car horns violently - at any hour and in any given situation. Bring your earplugs! The TV had mostly Turkish channels (including CNN Turk), an English movie channel(dubbed), and BBC World. The telephone worked, but made no ringing signal when a call was connected to the room. Staff would come running, telling me that I had a call. Breakfast was included in my rate, and was rather basic in my opinion: Hard boiled eggs, some fruit, bread, honey, jam and some cheese, coffee\tea and preserved juice. Not bad, but "rich" (as the hotel states on their internet site), is a bit of an exaggeration. The breakfast lounge is nice. The hotel itself looks somewhat worn, with lots of brown colored panels and fabrics. It seemed reasonably clean. The staff was friendly enough, about half of them speaking English to a level where you could make yourself well understood. They arrange for airport shuttle bus, which is a nice touch. All in all : "Troya" isn't a bad hotel, but if you're looking for a very relaxed and luxurious stay, it probably isn't the place to be. On the other hand, it's inexpensive. Some final points: - Consider where your interest lies - if they involve mostly history, mosques and culture, the Sulthanamet area would be a good place to look into. On the other side, if shopping and restaurants is more you preference, the Taksim \ Istical cadessi area seems to have the better selection. - Bring your earplugs - Get a good map (Istanbul streets can be confusing). The "Freemaps" which can be found at restaurants are fine. The ones given out at the hotel aren't nearly good enough. - Be prepared for intense traffic and crowded streets... But most of all, enjoy your stay in the fascinating, vibrant city that is Istanbul!

HotelInfo.Name: Troya Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Tepebasi, Mesrutiyet Caddesi. No:45 | Beyoglu, Istanbul 80050, Turkey
